info.title: Domain-CDE-Auth-Services
info.description:
Domain APIs to will need to interface with IAM provider partner services. In order to enforce CDR API access it will also need to integrate with Consent partner APIs. > Pirean API Contracts [SOP - IAM APIs](https://cuscalwiki.cuscalad.com/display/OB/SOP+-+IAM+APIs) [Readme](docs/Core/Consent/Readme-Auth-Domain.md) ### Changelog Change Date | Version | Description | Change Details ---------|----------|---------|--------- 15-Feb-2021 | 1.0.0 | Initial Draft | - 28-Mar-2021 | 1.0.1 | Updated GET /sessions/{tenantId} | > Updated the response model
> added x-trace-id mandatory header
> Updated constact to Stormtrooper Team 08-Jun-2021 | 1.0.2 | Added DCRS & Consent Grant endpoints | > Added POST /recipients/{recipientBrandId}/clients to onboard Data Recipient for DCRS
> Added POST /auth/{tenantId}/consent/token for Consent Grant flow
> Added POST /auth/{tenantId}/consent/grant to return y_return_code to A:1 22-Jun-2021 | 1.0.3 | Added revoke crd_arrangement_id endpoint & fixed path | > Added POST /{tenantId}/arrangements/{arrangementId}/revoke to revoke cdr_arrangement_id
> Removed extra auth from path of GET /{tenantId}/metrics, POST /{tenantId}/consent/token & POST /oauth/enforce/access
30-Jun-2021 | 1.0.4 | Updated POST /oauth/enforce/access & fixed errors | > Updated POST /oauth/enforce/access response model
> Removed clientId from POST /recipients/{recipientBrandId}/clients request body
> Replaced customerReference & customerReferencePpid with onlineBankingDhPpid & onlineBankingDhDrPpid respectively in POST /{tenantId}/consent/grant request model
> Removed request body from POST /{tenantId}/arrangements/{arrangementId}/revoke
> added tenantId in path param of POST /{tenantId}/recipients/{recipientBrandId}/clients
> added GET /{tenantId}/customers/{onlineBankingDhPpId} to be consumed by Pirean to service CDR GET /userinfo endpoint 21-Jul-2021 | 1.0.5 | Updated POST /oauth/enforce/access | > Renamed x-cuscal-x5t to x-cert-x5t and made it optional
> Added new enum "SPA" for purpose in request body > Replaced enums CDR_READ & B2B_READ with CDR & B2B for purpose in request body
> softwareSystemType & softwareProductId were made optional in the response body 27-Jul-2021 | 1.0.6 | Added 3 endpoints : POST /revoke, POST /signature & POST /otp | > POST /{tenantId}/consent/token/revoke endpoint will be used to initiate revoke authorization token to Pirean
> POST /token/signature endpoint will be used to verify JWT signature and obtain payload 09-Aug-2021 | 1.0.7 | Added new endpoints and updated exsisting endpoints to comply with design changes | > Added POST /{tenantId}/consent/customer/verify
> Added POST /{tenantId}/consent/token/elevate
> Updated POST /{tenantId}/consent/token request and response model
> Updated POST /{tenantId}/consent/grant request model to include userInfo 18-Aug-2021 | 1.0.8 | Added new endpoints to delete endpoint | > Added DELETE /sessions/caches/{key} 22-Aug-2021 | 1.0.9 | Enhanced to support ID Permanence | > Renamed following attributes in POST /{tenantId}/oauth/enforce/access response
        >> customerReferencePPID -> customerReferenceDh
        >> customerReferenceDRPPID -> customerReferenceDhDr
        >> onBehalfOfReferencePPID -> onBehalfOfReferenceDH
        >> onBehalfOfReferencePPID -> onBehalfOfReferenceDh
        >> accountPPID -> accountDhDr Updated POST /{tenantId}/oauth/enforce/access
> Added following attributes in POST /{tenantId}/oauth/enforce/access response
        >> keySetDH
        >> keySetDhDr
        >> recipientBrandId
> Renamed GET /{tenantId}/customers/{onlineBankingDhPpId} to GET /{tenantId}/customers/{customerReferenceDh}
> Renamed following attributes in POST /{tenantId}/consent/grant request
        >> onlineBankingDhPpid -> customerReferenceDh
        >> onlineBankingDhDrPpid -> customerReferenceDhDr
> As per the design update, removed scope from POST /{tenantId}/consent/token, POST /{tenantId}/consent/customer/verify & POST /{tenantId}/consent/token/elevate
Updated requst body of POST /{tenantId}/consent/grant to include shareUserInfo and make userInfo optional 1-Sep-2021 | 1.0.10 | Fixed error | > Updated response model of POST /enforce/access 24-Sep-2021 | 1.0.11 | Consent Revoke endpoints added & Updates to enforce access | > Added POST /{tenantId}/clients/revoke to inactivate consents on Pirean for removed Products
> Added POST /{tenantId}/grants/revoke to inactivate consents on Pirean when a consent is revoked by Data Holder consumer dashboard
> Updated POST /{tenantId}/oauth/enforce/access response with account status & scope
> Fixed errors GET /{tenantId}/metrics response model
Updated POST /{tenantId}/oauth/enforce/access to respond with customerReferenceDH (optional) for purpose = SPA 26-Nov-2021 | 1.0.12 | Updated GET /sessions/{tenantId} response to include security headers | > Added and empty headers object GET /sessions/{tenantId} response to include security headers. This will contain security header if any required by the client
Had to maintain the incorrect response model because fixing it would require changes on down stream APIs 28-Nov-2021 | 1.0.13 | Renamed GET /{tenantId}/metrics | > Renamed GET /{tenantId}/metrics to /{tenantId}/metrics/sessions
28-Mar-2022 | 1.0.14 | Added GET /{tenantId}/metrics/infosec | > Added GET /{tenantId}/metrics/infosec for Pirean Infosec API stats

post.description:
**Consumed by Cuscal Experience, CDR, B2B & SPA API layer to enforce token authorization**
As an IAM service I need to ensure that the party requesting this particular service (any service) is authenticated as registered both in ACCC registry and as DR or DH within SaaS tables. Additionally I need to ensure the caller is authorised to perform the action they are requesting. Story: 1206

Used by a client to request access and/or refresh tokens. 

This initial instnace of the API assumes clients are configured with the authentication method of "client_secret_post" and therefore expects that client credentials (id + password) will be present in POST body. 

Currentky allowing 3 grant types 
client_credentials
refresh_token
authorization_code
Story:
OB-1231
OB-1432

get.description:
Obtains the session as provided to Cuscal as relying party by a tenanted client

Story:

get.summary: get metrics data for ACCC reporting
get.description: Get session metrics from Pirean. The metrics represent the number of sessions started (i.e. number of access rtokens issued) for today and for last seven days)

parameters.name: dateTimeFrom
parameters.description: Fetch metrics starting from this date (for daily) or month (for monthly)

parameters.name: dateTimeTo
parameters.description: Fetch metrics ending on this date (for daily) or month (for monthly)

get.summary: get metrics data for ACCC reporting
get.description: Get Infosec API metrics from Pirean. The metrics is summary for the day for the infosec endpoints exposed to Data Recipients

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format. If date is not passed it must default previous day date. If todayâ€™s date is passed respond with error

x-trace-id.description: race identifier provided to Pirean - Pirean will return the value in the response. This is a correlation-id for this interaction.

post.description:
**Consumed by Cuscal Experience API layer**
Used by Cuscal to obtain a mfa-access token using a code issued by A:1. The token obtained through this interface is only scoped to support the completion of a OTP challenge thus its limited scope.

parameters.name: x-trace-id
parameters.description: race identifier provided to Pirean - Pirean will return the value in the response. This is a correlation-id for this interaction.

parameters.name: x-cert-x5t
parameters.description: Optional. Cuscal computed hash of the DR's certificate presented at mutual auth endpoints. Used to verify HOK.

post.description:
**Consumed by Cuscal Experience API layer**
Endpoint to provide consent details to A:1 to fetch y_return_code
Exp call via this endpoint to make a backchannel call to Pirean when consent grant is complete. This request allows Cuscal to provide Pirean sensitive details. It also receives information from Pirean on where . how to redirect back to IAM.

**Consumed by Cuscal Experience API layer to revoke SPA access token**
Revoke authorization tokens at Pirean

parameters.name: x-trace-id
parameters.description: This is a correlation-id for this interaction.

parameters.name: x-cert-x5t
parameters.description: Cuscal computed hash of the DR's certificate presented at mutual auth endpoints. Used to verify HOK.

post.description: **Consumed by Cuscal APIs layer to verify JWT signature**

parameters.name: x-trace-id
parameters.description: This is a correlation-id for this interaction.

post.description: **Consumed by Cuscal APIs layer to issue & validate OTP**

parameters.name: x-trace-id
parameters.description: This is a correlation-id for this interaction.

parameters.name: x-cert-x5t
parameters.description: Cuscal computed hash of the DR's certificate presented at mutual auth endpoints. Used to verify HOK.

post.description: Used by Cuscal to obtain a mfa-access token where the customer must exist in A:1.

parameters.name: x-trace-id
parameters.description: This is a correlation-id for this interaction.

parameters.name: x-cert-x5t
parameters.description: Optional. Cuscal computed hash of the DR's certificate presented at mutual auth endpoints. Used to verify HOK.

post.description: Obtain SPA access token once the otp challenge has completed. This call is used to change the scopes for a previously granted access token. The expiry and other claims will be carried over. Use this call once the OTP process has completed.

parameters.name: x-trace-id
parameters.description: This is a correlation-id for this interaction.
Optional. Cuscal computed hash of the DR's certificate presented at mutual auth endpoints. Used to verify HOK.
parameters.name: x-cert-x5t

post.description: **Endpoint will be used by Domain Consent Inactivate Consents & tokens associated with a Software Product**
**This endpoint will be used by Doman Consent API to inactivate Consents & Tokens on Pirean**

**Consumed by Pirean**
Endpoint used by Pirean to onboard a Data recipeint to Cassie during DCRS.
Note: the recipient is not a tenant, thus referred to as brand.
The tenant is the Cuscal Hosted Tenant with which the recipient is registering Signed JWS has to be passed in Authorization header as Bearer token

parameters.name: x-external-trace-id
parameters.description: race identifier provided by Pirean. Cuscal will supply the same header in the response.

parameters.name: x-external-trace-id
parameters.description: Trace identifier provided by Pirean. Cuscal will supply the same header in the response.

post.description:
**Consumed by Pirean**
Pirean advising Cuscal to revoke consents associated with an arrangement
Signed JWS has to be passed in Authorization header as Bearer token
Endoint will be called by Pirean via VPN to revoke consent related to a cdr_arrangement_id

get.description:
**Consumed by Pirean**
Used to obtain real-time data about a customer who has an active consent, used to populate a response in the /userInfo endpoint exposed by Pirean Pirean provides the tokenised customer identity recorded at the time of consent, Cuscal obtains the latest details from the client through existing B2B interface

delete.description:
This end point will be used to delete a cache record using cache Key. This will be used for Tesing only. This endpoint must not be exposed to any edge API. This call must be audited
This end-point must not be deployed in Production environment.

client_id.description: as granted to the data recipient when onboarded

scope.description: must match one of the scopes defined at the time the caller was accredited. If passed and valid, the access toekn generated will bind to provided scope(s)

grant_type.description: Type of grant flow. Assume client credentials

refresh_token.description: Where grant_type of "refresh_token" is  provided, the caller musy include a valid refresh_token, it will be exchanged for a new set of tokens

token_type.description: The type of access token granted

expires_in.description: Number of seconds the access token will expire from creation

token.description: bearer token to be used for accessing external partner API

sessionToken.description: Issued by A:1 and used by the SPA to secure interactions with experience APIs. Also called a session token. A:1 referes to it as x-access-token

consentHash.description: Identifier for consent issued by Cassie

customerReferenceDh.description: the tokenized identifier of the customer's online banking id, who created and owns the consent - aka delegatedBy

customerReferenceDhDr.description: the tokenized identifier of the customer's online banking id, who created and owns the consent - aka delegatedBy. This one is provided to DR to comply with ACCC Id permanence

cdrArrangementId.description: Identifier to link together individual re-authorised consents over time

shareUserInfo.description: This value specifies if the user info can be shared to DR or not. The value must always be passed in lower cases.

yCode.description: a random code issued by A:1 featured in the redirect back to Pirean after the consent grant flow has completed.

DomainAuthEnforceAccess_post_v1.title: DomainAuthEnforceAccess_post_v1
DomainAuthEnforceAccess_post_v1.description: Model containing parameters for /oath/enforce/access post request end point

token.description: Bearer Token as extracted from call header

apiScope.description: the authorization scope assigned to the calling API endpoint, this method ensures that the apiScope is the set of scopes bound to the provided token.

accountDhDr.description: List of account PPIDs supplied by Data Recipient

DomainAuthEnforceAccess_v1.title: DomainEnforceAccess_v1
DomainAuthEnforceAccess_v1.description: Model for Domain Auth POST /oauth/enforce/access response > ***consentDetail*** is conditional, mandatory if there is consent associated with the token being introspected

scope.description: The list of scopes obtained from Pirean introspect call

customerReferenceDH.description: Tokenised value of the CustomerId. This is a conditional field and only applicable for Consumer Dashboard token introspect

DomainAuthGrantEnforceResponse_v1.title: DomainAuthGrantEnforceResponse
DomainAuthGrantEnforceResponse_v1.description: Object returned as a response to enforce consent call

customerReference.description: Customer of the Data Holder that has authorised the consent

customerReferenceDhDr.description: CustomerReference encrypted with use of DR & DH based seed

onBehalfOfReference.description: Entity whose data is being shared

onBehalfOfReferenceDh.description: tokenised value of Entity whose data is being shared,

accountNumber.description: clear value of the account Id included in this consent

accountDhDr.description: tokenised value of this account Id

failedRequests.description: Number of failed requestes during the day

requestsMetSla.description: The requests that were responded within the SLA during the day

requestsFailedSla.description: The requests that were not responded within the SLA during the day

count.description: Total number of requests received in the hour

averageResponseTime.description: Average response time during the hour.

DomainAuthMetricsSessions_v1.title: DomainAuthMetricsSessions
DomainAuthMetricsSessions_v1.description: General purpose metrics data model represented as array of objects consisting of date and number

date.description: Date that the value relates to (daily dd/mm/yyyy)

name.description: End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts.

givenName.description: Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User. If the End-User is known by only one name then it is recorded in the givenName

familyName.description: Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User

updatedAt.description: Time the End-User's information was last updated. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z to the UTC updated_at time

code.description: Must be one of the following: 0001 â€“ Account not able to be found

title.description: Must be one of the following: Invalid account

detail.description: ID of the account not found

meta.description: Optional additional data for specific error types

token.description:
Bearer token. 
Can be either of the following:
1\. Sent with a SPA request in the HTTP Authentication header.
2\. Signed or Encrypted JWT

caller.description: The sender of the JWT. If the JWT is from Piream then pass A:1, else the tenantId

purpose.description: The purpose/feature name for which the JWT was sent. For example: DCRS, Consent Grant, Consent Managment

jwt.description: The JWT supplied for signature verfication

payload.description: This is a JSON node. Payload of the JWS.

token.description:
Bearer token. 
Can be either of the following:
1\. Sent with a SPA request in the HTTP Authentication header.
2\. Signed or Encrypted JWT

rCode.description: Represents a unique session between A:1 and the Consent Grant SPA (authentication)

customerReferencePpId.description: Customer Reference/ Delegated By tokenised DH keysets

recipientBrandId.description: Data Recipient Brand Id assigned by ACCC

otpMode.description: The OTP action that has to be performed. This is an enumerated field

sendBy.description: The channel by which OTP has to be delivered. This is mandatory if otpMode = generate_and_send

sendTo.description: The mobile number or email to which OTP has to be sent. This is mandatory if otpMode = generate_and_send. Follow email (RFC5322) & mobile standard (RFC3966) standards

incomingOtp.description: The OTP value entered by consumer on the dashboard. This is mandatory if otpMode = validate
